title: AHG buys new trucks as logistics sale docs finalised
text:
As private equity and trade types pore over Automotive Holdings' up-for-sale refrigerated logistics division, the unit's boss has been crowing about some recent purchases.

Automotive Holdings executive Stephen Cleary told staff last week that an information memorandum had been finalised and sent to "a number of prospective buyers", who have a few weeks to stump up indicative bids to bankers at Luminis Partners and UBS.

Cleary said the documents were finalised as Automotive Holdings had been bulking up its fleet in time for summer – perhaps showing new owner AP Eagers hadn't cut off head office support.

Automotive Holdings' refrigerated logistics fleet includes about 550 prime movers and rigid delivery vehicles, 1250 road trailers and 480 rail containers. Dominic Lorrimer

"We are constantly improving and adding to our fleet with more fuel efficient vehicles and embracing technologies that will enhance safety as well as lower running costs," he said.

"Our road and rail fleet, which is already the largest in the industry, underpins our forecast growth into the future. We have spent more than $11 million dollars this quarter to buy prime movers, fridge vans and rigid vehicles, many of which will be delivered in time for our busiest time of year."
description: While Automotive Holdings' refrigerated logistics division is being studied, the unit's boss has made some purchases.
